title: Technology:  Samsung Profit to Rise by 53%  ----  By Jiyoung Sohn
text:
SEOUL -- Samsung Electronics Co. expects a 53% rise in operating profit for the second quarter, lifted by strong demand for memory chips that offset weaker device sales hurt by component shortages.

The world's largest smartphone and memory chip maker forecast operating profit of 12.5 trillion South Korean won, equivalent to about $11 billion, for the quarter ended June 30. Samsung also projects revenue of 63 trillion won, up 19% from the prior year.

The South Korean firm's outlook handily topped market expectations and showed continuing strength for technology companies and especially chip makers that have seen greater pricing power amid a supply crunch.

A year ago, during the pandemic's first months, Samsung saw a double-digit percentage drop in revenue for electronics products like smartphones and televisions. But demand for components surged as people shifted more of their lives online. Results have remained strong since.

Analysts' estimates gathered by S&P Global Market Intelligence were about 10.9 trillion won in operating profit and 61.2 trillion won in revenue.

Samsung reports full earnings this month. The Suwon, South Korea, company is considered to be an industry bellwether because it is both a major electronics maker and a components supplier to the world's biggest tech firms such as Apple Inc. and Sony Group Corp.

Samsung is likely to see its smartphone shipments decline by 20% from the previous quarter, according to Doh Hyun-woo, an analyst at NH Securities in Seoul, in a recent note to investors.

Part of that drop is due to Covid-19 outbreaks in growth markets like India, which sapped consumer demand. Some suppliers to Samsung's handset business have warned of production bottlenecks.
